description: Throughout history, coins have served as important tools to convey leaders' power. This rare example depicts Empress Irene, one of only three female rulers to hold sole power during the Byzantine Empire. She wears a crown with pearl adornments and a jewel-encrusted scarf and holds an orb and cross-topped staff—all traditional accessories that signaled male imperial power and dominion over the Christian world.
title: Solidus (Coin) of Empress Irene
